intro: Chaetospira, commonly known as the sea hare, is a genus of marine gastropod mollusks belonging to the family Aplysiidae. These creatures are characterized by their soft, gelatinous bodies and the presence of specialized structures called cerata, which are used for respiration and defense. Chaetospira species typically inhabit shallow coastal waters and are often found in rocky or sandy substrates. They are herbivorous, feeding primarily on algae and other plant matter. Their unique morphology and ecological role make them important components of marine ecosystems.
